Class GameSettingsStore

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.config.GameSettingsStore
public class GameSettingsStore extends Object
Persists GameSettings to a portable properties file (defaults to ~/.tetrisjfx/settings.properties).

Tests and power users can override the storage location with the following system properties (highest priority first):

  1. tetris.settings.file — explicit path to the file
  2. tetris.settings.dir — directory that will contain settings.properties
  3. tetris.data.dir — shared data directory used by both settings and high scores
Writes are performed via a temporary file rename so half-written files are avoided on crash or power loss.

  • Method Details

    • load

      public GameSettings load()
      Loads persisted settings or falls back to GameSettings.defaultSettings() if the file is missing or unreadable.
      Returns:
      in-memory immutable settings snapshot

    • save

      public void save(GameSettings settings)
      Writes the provided settings atomically to the properties file, creating the target directory if necessary.
      Parameters:
      settings - snapshot to persist

    • getBaseDirectory

      public Path getBaseDirectory()
      Returns the resolved base directory so callers (tests) can assert the location.
      Returns:
      directory containing the settings file

    • getSettingsFile

      public Path getSettingsFile()
      Returns the resolved settings file which may be overridden by system properties.
      Returns:
      path to the backing file
